intro: Nepeta nepetella subsp. cordifolia, commonly known as heartleaf catmint, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It features aromatic, lance-shaped leaves that are often heart-shaped, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
